Text: BNP Paribas NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST DOEs were seen as more negative than APIs and will lead to a slightly more bearish tone this morning Other nuggets on stats Gasoline demand remains solid Heating oil days of supply fell to over last year and demand reflected colder than normal temps in the US Anyway not a huge surprise in the numbers The large range game should continue as conflicting geopolitical and fundamental factors cancel each other out and lead to inaction OPEC is now reported leaking up to mmbd Russian overproduction is still a concern However Iran and Iraq may be draw into the larger military conflict and Irans current war of words with Israel makes that seem more immediate So what to do Well were still in a larger downtrend as stocks and negative paper spreads make clear Many are still pinning their hopes on gas season and demand is still nicely robust The key will be blending ability and the overall health of the economy The uncertainty of last year for refiners is largely removed due to the resolution of the Unocal debacle That at least gives refiners and blenders a clear playing field Now the economy If chemical jet and industrial demand remains soft refiners wont see competiton for those blending components So we probably will still not see anyone putting all their cards on the table until the start of March but my gut says there will be no problem making summer spec gas and that talk of a huge gas demand season is largely overblown Passenger load on airlines now looks to be less than below preSept th levels and a soft economy doesnt necessarily imply people will drive to vacations rather than fly they may just cut back entirely Anyway until the question of gas season is solved we will likely not budge from the existing but volatile range AprilJune gas cracks did settle back at but thats not a big deal given that the range of these over the past two months is Ce message et toutes les pieces jointes ciapres le message BNP Paribas NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST Well Thursday turned into quite a corker when for most of the day it looked like nothing would happen A late run up on products expiry caught the market off guard and we were able to settle back above the mark which seems now very unimportant Believe it or not were still in a range albeit a choppy and volatile one Incremental fund positions are getting chopped up The Access after market was extremely active and volatile on news reports of a natural gas pipeline explosion near the KuwaitIraq border We ran up to before the hysteria died down We then sold back off to In the light of calm both are seen as overreactions and we should come in right around unchanged for spot crude The worry over the pipeline story wasnt necessarily on a supply disruption but the cause of teh explosion Its proximity to the Iraqi border raised more wide ranging issues Heat spreads saw a solid jump up MarApr into AprMay MayJune All extended momentum whether up or down appears to have waned Summer gas cracks are holding on in front of another sign that the downward momentum isnt there right now OPEC comments that they would cut production if other producers flooded the market iie Russia and a so far failed threatened strike by refinery workers in the US Gulf Coast are also causing some volatility Good luck today Ce message et toutes les pieces jointes ciapres le BNP Paribas NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST Just when you throw in the towel after last weeks move reality comes back and bites you on the butt Yesterdays action saw funds getting right back into the short side on flat price and spreads moved right back to their weakest levels seen late Thursday The move back below will reassert the short term bear tone medium and longer term tone have stayed consistently bearish Im still looking for a move sometime in February towards weather is not cooperating and gasoline imports continue to put a damper on the near term fundamental window that had opened Crude spreads are much weaker on Access Dampening prospects of economic recovery cannot be helping either DOEs were even more bearish than APIs Ce message et toutes les pieces jointes ciapres le message sont etablis a lintention exclusive de ses destinataires et sont confidentiels Si vous recevez ce message par erreur merci de le detruire et den avertir immediatement lexpediteur Toute utilisation de ce message non conforme a sa destination toute diffusion ou toute publication totale ou partielle est interdite sauf autorisation expresse Linternet ne permettant pas dassurer lintegrite de ce message BNP PARIBAS et ses filiales declinent toute responsabilite au titre de ce message dans lhypothese ou il aurait ete modifie This message and any attachments the message are intended solely for the addressees and are confidential If you receive this message in error please delete it and immediately notify the sender Any use not in accord with its purpose any dissemination or disclosure either whole or partial is prohibited except formal approval The internet can not guarantee the integrity of this message BNP PARIBAS and its subsidiaries shall will not therefore be liable for the message if modified

BNP Paribs NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST Well first of all lets stop talking about for a while The stubborn facade I was wearing in the face of mounting bullish evidence was not the way to go as Friday capped a very impressive performance last week So leason learned listen to whatever system you trust because a system takes human nature out fo the equation The bull trap Friday looked like the real thing for most of the day with heavy spread depreciation and fund selling but with about an hour to go you could sense something was amiss So for now weve done what we needed to do technically and it has to be respected The overall long term trend remains decidedly bearish but short term weve gone bullish medium term neutral Petrologistics shows OPEC sans Iraq at bd over the new quota pretty much what has been bandied about recently Gasoline relationships have held like a rock and AprilJune gas cracks are now back into the midhigh range Ce message et toutes les pieces jointes ciapres le BNP Paribas NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST I know Ive been heavily bearish and saying that a close above would get me back into a neutral tone but Im going to stick with even the near term bear view for one more day The market is reacting bearishly to what I see as neutral stats Distillate demand is high due to run cuts and exports but the fundamental window of opportunity may have passed us by By that I mean that the traditional late Q rally is usually brought on by run cuts combined with cold weather Weather is not cooperating and gasoline has been flowing over here Price action for the past three days has been firm especially the past two with solid spread action Still cant get behind the move fighting it a bit a strong settle today has to change the short term bear strategy I am still extremely worried about the possibility of Russian oil companies ignoring the OPEC quota and jumping over themselves to raise hard currency Ce message et toutes les pieces jointes ciapres le message sont etablis a lintention exclusive de ses destinataires et sont confidentiels Si vous recevez ce message par erreur merci de le detruire et den avertir immediatement lexpediteur Toute utilisation de ce message non conforme a sa destination toute diffusion ou toute publication totale ou partielle est interdite sauf autorisation expresse Linternet ne permettant pas dassurer lintegrite de ce message BNP PARIBAS et ses filiales declinent toute responsabilite au titre de ce message dans lhypothese ou il aurait ete modifie This message and any attachments the message are intended solely for the addressees and are confidential If you receive this message in error please delete it and immediately notify the sender Any use not in accord with its purpose any dissemination or disclosure either whole or partial is prohibited except formal approval The internet can not guarantee the integrity of this message BNP PARIBAS and its subsidiaries shall will not therefore be liable for the message if modified

BNP Paribas NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST Yesterdays run up doesnt at least at first glance resemble a major bottom Yes we did make a new low and settle higher setting the stage for a possible reversal To confirm we need to see a settle above the high from Tuesday The reason it didnt resemble a major bottom was the lack of solid spread action Crude spreads barely budged even at the highs If people were really seeing yesterday as a potential bottom it should have been reflected in more nervousness in short crude spreads The only market that did react spreadwise was heating oil Turnarounds and a mildly improving overseas market have had some effect MarApr in particular has moved in from to flat Replacing barrels during turnaround at close to carry makes sense anything in premium only makes sense if a squeeze opportunity arises Given the huge stock overhang in PADD One and lack of extended cold weather I dont see this as viable Paper players are clearly very short however and that has some bearing Back on the short spread angle you could make the case for a lack of covering until a strong settle was seen If the majority sees yesterdays settle as important we should see a definite crude spread reaction today A decent number of out of the money calls were exercised last night we havent seen that play in some time Gas demand fell of the table and gasheat continues to look soft Ce BNP Paribas NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST Friday confirmed all the ominous signs from earlier in the week ie weak spreads lack of short covering after a large down move and particularly gasolines erosion All these things pointed to the markets seeing gasoline as vulnerable and laid the groundwork for this week which has all the makings a very sharp and quick sell off Gann lines show the close below to be significant and point to a very quick move towards I would not be surprised to see this achieved this week as the move accelerates Gasoline will be particularly hard hit with Q gas cracks seen as a target The problem with gasoline this year stems from distillate Even a solid turnaround schedule will not lead to much since an abundance of heating oil and lack of sustained cold weather will give refiners a nice margin for error Gas even though the demand picture should stay firm is seen as the one component that has some fat left in it Everything else has had premium and margins taken out of it already The only thing to watch for is a reversal since we finsihed Friday on the days low Look out below Ce message et toutes les pieces jointes ciapres le message sont etablis a lintention BNP Paribas NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST Yesterdays overproduction numbers have lent a bearish tone to things this morning Cold weather is too little too late as well get back to above normal temps by tomorrow Heat spreads suffered mightily yesterdayas did cracks as product fixed two weeks ago will find a home over here again Some think FebMar has more bearish potential than JanFeb I dont think so but I also dont think you ride that horse too long Hope you all appreciate my downhome metaphor With recent movement you now have to wonder if theres any justification for any backwardation on the heat c urve and all we have left is AprMay Crude spread movement apart from the first two spreads has been slowly bullish and that tells me not to be short outright price overall DecDec now out to weve now returned to backwardation all across the crude curve apart from the first two People now wait for any signs of the FebMar Brent squeeze bleeding over here Gas cracks still firm gasheat with solid movement yesterday Ce message et toutes les pieces jointes ciapres le message sont etablis a lintention exclusive de ses destinataires et sont confidentiels Si vous recevez ce message par erreur BNP Paribas NYMEX Floor AM UpdatePST Well lets get back to basics since timing here on daily moves has been tough Are we still mired in a long term downtrend Have things at least cleaned up a little over the past two weeks Is the physical overhang somewhat counterbalanced by concerns over a widening of military action against other nations say IranIraq If you answered yes to all of these youre eligible to read further Just some facts The US Northeast is now seeing the coldest temperatures all season yet heat cracks lost value yesterday Gas cracks are still holding the range a sign the market is still willing to give gas season the benefit of the doubt but not much more Russia is still a concern for overproduction A very soft economy and a desire for hard currency could easily lead Russian oil companies to cheat the recent quota The technical pattern looks very much like a bearish head and shoulderssee chart below Im referring only to the most recent range between and At the very least it implies we will test the neckline again in the next two weeks This comes in right at A close below would signal thew move towards that looks inevitable for now since the dominant channel is a downward one You can also see how weve had difficulty establishing as resistance or support this is key since it will determine whether the next move is to or Since gas is the seasonal product and gas cracks are still firm the range is still dominant I would expect a close below would be coupled with a move back to or below on Q gas cracks But for now expect the move back towards to get funds shorter again then also expect the market to use those new shorts as an upside squeeze play Embedded image moved to file picpcx Ce message et toutes les pieces jointes ciapres le message sont
